description.narrative: Philippines - Revenue Administration Reform Project: Address the need to raise tax revenues and reduce tax evasion and revenue agent-related corruption by increasing the efficiency and sustainability of revenue collection through a redesign and computerization of business processes.

title.narrative: Measuring Results of the Philippines Revenue Administration and Reform Project

condition.narrative: 16) Prior to the initial Disbursement of Program Funding, the Bureau of Internal Revenue shall have established a Project Implementation & Monitoring Office, directly under the Office of the Commissioner, who will have (i) full time and permanent staff members dedicated to the design and implementation of tax reform initiatives, including those supported by the Compact, (ii) sufficient number of support staff to complete the respective phases of the eTIS sub-activity, and (iii) clear responsibility for all modernization initiatives.

17) By February 27, 2012, and annually thereafter, the International Monetary Fund shall submit to MCC an annual assessment of the Bureau of Internal Revenue?s continued demonstration of commitment to tax reform as evidenced by: (i) follow-through on decisions to reallocate staff to high priority tasks and units (such as enforcement, registration, large taxpayers, and internal audit); (ii) the successful deployment of the electronic Tax Information System, including modules that enhance the Bureau of Internal Revenue?s capability to monitor actions and approvals related to tax filings and assessments, based on mutually agreed upon targets set at the beginning of every year; and (iii) the maintenance and satisfactory staffing of the tax reform group referred to in paragraph 3.a. above.

18) Prior to the initial Disbursement of Program Funding, the Philippines? Revenue Integrity Protection Service shall have (i) an approved and funded budget to hire a minimum of twenty-five (25) full time and permanent staff and (ii) hired or acquired through internal transfers key members of the Revenue Integrity Protection Service and an adequate number of support staff.

19) Prior to the initial Disbursement of Program Funding, the Bureau of Internal Revenue shall have entered into an Implementing Entity Agreement with MCA-Philippines, in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, to ensure proper implementation of the Revenue Administration Reform Project.
